channel.title: Mozilla Firefox
channel.description: I need some help. I just recently noticed that my Firefox has begun crashing. And it's a strange way it does it. I can be viewing a page. And the program freezes, then it says "(Not Responding)". I believe that it may be JavaScript that may be causing it to crash. It only recently happened, and may have been caused by me Forcing it to quit, or shutting my computer down outside of the safety shutdown. If anyone has any idea as to why it is crashing. The help is greatly appreciated.

item.title: Mozilla Firefox
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

Clear your cookies and your cache. That page may still be in cache, causing all the crash-fuckery.

Read full topic

item.title: Mozilla Firefox
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

How should Firefox not understand a javascript?

Read full topic

item.title: Mozilla Firefox
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Rectified my ass talking? I know exactly what I’m talking about. I did visit a page that had a ‘CPU intensive JavaScript code in their page’. And it did make my Computer crash. That may be the link to why it is crashing now is what I am saying.

Read full topic

item.title: Mozilla Firefox
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

ThAt0n36Uy:

I’ve reinstalled. I’m an experienced, long time user. So simple things like that are overlooked by me. I suspect that Firefox is crashing because it doesn’t understand a JavaScript. This just started happening. And there’s no apparent reason as to why. I do remember visiting a certain page on this site, that made it lag like hell, and shut my computer down. I think it may have started after that. I got some sort of Driver error. I visited the page in Firefox. Because I thought it only worked on IE.

Your talking out of your arse, sorry. Firefox could crash if somebody sticks an infinite loop of some CPU intensive JavaScript code in their page, but the only reason they would do that is to crash your browser. Firefox won’t crash be cause it “Doesn’t understand a JavaScript”, try sticking random jibberish in some tags and see what happens

EDIT: You appear to have rectified your arse talking. My bad.

Read full topic

item.title: Mozilla Firefox
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

I’ve reinstalled. I’m an experienced, long time user. So simple things like that are overlooked by me. I suspect that Firefox is crashing because it doesn’t understand a JavaScript. This just started happening. And there’s no apparent reason as to why. I do remember visiting a certain page on this site, that made it lag like hell, and shut my computer down. I think it may have started after that. I got some sort of Driver error. I visited the page in Firefox. Because I thought it only worked on IE.

EDIT: I decided I might Google it (I thought I wouldn’t find any information.) And found that it’s an unfixed error. And can be caused by JavaScript that is set in an infinite loop. Or a badly coded webpage. Though it happens more often on Moparisthebest, and on download sites. I doubt that it’s bad coding.

Read full topic

item.title: Mozilla Firefox
item.dc:creator: @dbzmaster555 dbzmaster
item.description:
@dbzmaster555 wrote:

Yeah this has been happening to my firefox recently also. everything in my internet and steam or anything just disconnects,and when I check out if someone turned off the internet connection it was normal.
I guess just re-install or use Opera.

Read full topic

item.title: Mozilla Firefox
item.dc:creator: @pk4pk pk4pk
item.description:
@pk4pk wrote:

This has been happining with my IE even though I should not really be surprised…just try to re-install it or maybe re-install java, and send an error report.

Read full topic

item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

I need some help. I just recently noticed that my Firefox has begun crashing. And it’s a strange way it does it. I can be viewing a page. And the program freezes, then it says “(Not Responding)”. I believe that it may be JavaScript that may be causing it to crash. It only recently happened, and may have been caused by me Forcing it to quit, or shutting my computer down outside of the safety shutdown. If anyone has any idea as to why it is crashing. The help is greatly appreciated.
